website_summaries.verdict: The Monoprice Hi-Fi Over-the-Ear Headphones deliver a mids- and highs-focused, flat response-style sound signature that's rare to find in this price range.
pros: Includes detachable audio cable with remote and mic, zip-up hard shell case
cons: Can sound a bit thin on certain genres

customer_reviews.title: Good sounding, tight if you have a big head.
customer_reviews.text: Well they are fantastic sounding headphones, without a doubt worth the price. My one issue with them is that they are a bit tight. My ears hurt a little bit after having them on for longer than 20 minutes. I'm sure that's something that will go away as the plastic stretched to better fit my head. I do have a big head after all so I can't blame the headphones too much!
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Least would have to be that sometimes there's a small fuzzy sound or hum when it's quiet vocals only in a song, but it's not too noticeable so I'm not really worried about it. They're great as far as I'm concerned. Nice sturdy aux cable with a good length, headphones are durable with a good weight to them, the turning ear pieces are really handy, the cushioning is plentiful without being overbearing, the sound is clear as well as spot on, and the travelling case is a nice sturdy material as well with a great fit for the headphones and the cord. I have no real complaints other than I wish I could have gotten them in purple.
customer_reviews.author: Envy

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, ill-fitting.
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful for these, having read reviews for them elsewhere, but they were not what I expected. The carrying/storage case they come with is nice, and I like that the cable is detachable, but the headphones themselves feel flimsy and the sound is really flat and tinny. They don't cancel out ANY noise whatsoever, so you have to listen to music at a higher volume if you want to drown out your morning commute like me. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lizardo McFly

customer_reviews.title: They worked great! I was 2 seats away from a crying ...
customer_reviews.text: Used these on a long haul flight. They worked great! I was 2 seats away from a crying baby and I was able to sleep great playing my soothing sleep music and I could not hear the baby cry. They are made really really well. High quality. I'd highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gooniegirl37

customer_reviews.title: The headphones are great but I had to replace the cable that connects ...
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are great but I had to replace the cable that connects the headphone to the player device. Upon opening the cable had the cracking sound like a bad connection when the wires get old. Replaced with a better braided cable and it sounds great, just done have the control button (volume, plus, play) that was in the wire but still able to control through the player device.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Good sound and comfy. Noise cancelling works well. Bass boost is a nice touch. Comes with a good (although short) cable and a really cool case.
customer_reviews.author: JVII

customer_reviews.title: These earphones fit well over the ear and give excellent sound
customer_reviews.text: These earphones fit well over the ear and give excellent sound. I wear hearing aids and need large ear cups. These do the job. I have worn more comfortable headphones ( I was a commercial pilot for forty years), but for the price these are fine for listening to Pandora on my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Rooman

customer_reviews.title: No longer available through monoprice but great phones
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Bought as an extra set should my original set wear out. Great value. I wish monoprice hadn't discontinued these.
customer_reviews.author: Marty McGlothlin

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money...
customer_reviews.text: These are good headphones for the money. Despite what they say about 20Hz to 20kHz, I tested them with some online test tones. It's more like 30Hz to 14kHz (although I'm too old for higher than that!)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable and sounds great
customer_reviews.text: These exceeded my expectations. They are very comfortable and sounds great. I have an iPhone 6 and there is more than enough power to push these. Great highs, mids, and lows. I highly recommend these to stone and would by these again.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT FOR REASONABLE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: THESE BLOCK OUT MOST OF THE OUTSIDE SOUND AND PRICE GREAT AS SO MANY OTHERS WHANT $200/300. THIS IS WOTH THE PRICE I PAID. I WISH THEY WERE MORE COMFORTABLE AROUND THE EARS BUT WILL PROBABLY IMPROVE AND SOFTEN AFTER USE.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: I use them to dull my coffee grinding in the AM when I am ...
customer_reviews.text: work well, not fancy, a tad bulky, but I have bought the expensive brand names and they fall apart after using a year. I use them to dull my coffee grinding in the AM when I am not jumping on planes to dull crying babies or chatty passengers.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: Average build quality. For $81.55USD I would have expected slightly better. I only had the headphones for 3 months before the headband decided to break (see attached photo). Quality: 1/5 Comfort: 3/5 The quality of sound incl. noise cancellation: 3/5
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Blomfield

customer_reviews.title: Easy to ware, easy to install and the sound is great.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and light. Win7 found the drivers and was up in a minute or so.
customer_reviews.author: CWA

customer_reviews.title: Just excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones with an amazing price. What else can you ask for
customer_reviews.author: A person

customer_reviews.title: Headband cracked
customer_reviews.text: These were a great price and recommended by Consumer Reports. They sounded great also. After less than 30 days the headband cracked and split almost all the way through. I have to send these back and that is going to be a major hassle. My 17 year old son is very careful with his electronics, the damage was not due to negligence.
customer_reviews.author: PENNYB

customer_reviews.title: ++ Crisp and Clean audio with comfortable fit ++
customer_reviews.text: These Monoprice Hi-Fi Over-the-Ear Headphones deliver a mids- and highs-focused, flat response-style sound signature that's rare to find in this price range apart from the Shure headphones here:  PROS: + Crisp, clean, mids-focused audio performance. + Comfortable, well-padded fit. + Includes detachable audio cable with remote and mic, zip-up hard shell case. CONS: - Can sound a bit thin on certain genres.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Painful to wear for extended periods
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to give this a bad review. For the price, the sound and build are fantastic. The problem is that if I wear it for more than 30 minutes it becomes very painful on my head and ears. I was using these to listen to music at work or watch videos on an iPad but just half an episode in and my head begins to ache. As much as I like them otherwise I would not recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: glyph

customer_reviews.title: Ok Sound, Poor Noise Cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Had these for almost a year now. The noise cancellation doesn't work very well, only notice slight dulling of outside noise. It actually sounds like the volume is just being increased when turned on. After the first month, the top band snapped in half, they still work but don't fit as snugly. Contacted Monoprice online and they did not get back to me for several months, then said they were going to ship out a new pair a few months ago but I never received them. Monoprice makes a couple other decent headphones but wouldn't recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Linsey Grove

customer_reviews.title: The sound produced is very nice though.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing size for those of us with larger heads. My glasses get pressed against my head very tightly when wearing these, making the comfort level very low. The sound produced is very nice though.
customer_reviews.author: liquidhot

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't get it through Monoprice's comically bad 30-day warranty system
customer_reviews.text: Avoid at all costs. The cheap plastic component that goes above the head snaps and breaks with regular use, leaving the headphones dangling off of the ear and completely undermining the noise canceling feature. Mine broke in less than a month of careful use. Unfortunately, I couldn't get it through Monoprice's comically bad 30-day warranty system. You might think you are saving money, but you won't be when you have to buy another pair of (higher quality) headphones within six months.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan

product_meta.title: Monoprice Hi-Fi Over-the-Ear Acoustic Pro Studio Headphones (112230)
product_meta.description: Enjoy the sonic clarity and isolation that comes from using Hi-Fi Over-the-Ear Headphones from Moonrise! These headphones feature a comfortable, over-the-ear fit, which helps keep prevent outside noises from interfering with your music. They feature a 20Hz ~~ 20kHz 10dB frequency response and a 99dB SPL. The removable audio cable includes an inline controller and built-in microphone, so you can use these headphones for phone calls. The inline controller allows you to pause/resume playback and adjust the volume level up or down.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars39 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
